benchmark_details.name: WebCode2M
benchmark_details.overview: WebCode2M is a new dataset comprising 2.56 million instances, each containing a design image along with the corresponding webpage code and layout details, aimed at improving webpage code generation through Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a large-scale real-world dataset for generating webpage code from webpage designs to enhance the performance of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs).

data.source: Web pages sourced from the Common Crawl dataset, filtered and processed to collect design images and corresponding HTML/CSS code.
data.annotation: Data quality ensured by a scoring model trained on a manually annotated subset of 10,000 entries, achieving validation accuracy of 90%.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on comparison between generated webpage structures and ground truth during the evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating accurate and aesthetically pleasing webpage code.
methodology.baseline_results: WebCoder significantly outperformed models like Design2Code-18B and WebSight VLM-8B.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated by comparing different baseline models against the newly introduced WebCoder model.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes diverse languages and different webpage styles, improving representation.
targeted_risks.harm: The dataset may contain inappropriate content that requires careful handling.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Samples filtered for inappropriate content, including NSFW images and harmful keywords.
